definition: to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to talk big/to shoot off one's mouth/to chat (dialect)
to fizzle out/to come to nothing
as easy as blowing off dust/effortless/with ease
pinyin: bu4 fei4 chui1 hui1 zhi1 li4

definition: lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
(idiom) to be exposed to the elements
lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick

sentences.english: We recommend you to use the fist way of containing only one hole to play single note.
sentences.chinese: 我們推薦使用第一種方法，口含一孔吹單音。

sentences.english: The breeze fanned our faces, please turn the fan off.
sentences.chinese: 微風輕輕吹在我們的臉上，請把電扇關掉。

sentences.english: Blooms also happen in the winter, however, when northeast winds blow offshore.
sentences.chinese: 然而，當冬季東北風吹向海洋時，水華也會出現。

sentences.english: To doff one's hat . Some men's hat is easily blow away as their head.
sentences.chinese: 有些人的帽子，就象他們的腦子一樣，很容易被吹走。

sentences.english: We can enjoy the sea breeze and the soft sand.
sentences.chinese: 我們能吹吹海風，還能踩在軟軟的沙子上。

sentences.english: We can enjoy the sea breeze and the soft sand.
sentences.chinese: 我們能吹吹海風，還能踩在軟軟的沙子上。

sentences.english: He would order 300 musicians at a time to play the Yu for him.
sentences.chinese: 有一個南郭先生，本來不會吹竽，也混在中間湊數。

sentences.english: Maybe it is because that boasting is tax-free that they dare to boast more and more.
sentences.chinese: 也許因爲吹牛是免稅的，他們纔敢大吹特吹。

sentences.english: He can withhold the China nationalism and in the same time to blow his horn of democracy loudly.
sentences.chinese: 他一邊能守住民族大義，也能高吹民主的號角。

sentences.english: Soon the wind had piled the snow into drifts .
sentences.chinese: 不久，風把雪吹積成一堆一堆的。

sentences.english: The farmer whistled as the cow milked .
sentences.chinese: 牛產奶時，那位農民吹着口哨。

sentences.english: Thus, the sun hid behind clouds, the wind started blowing up.
sentences.chinese: 然後，太陽躲到雲後，風開始吹。
人們從早上六點就開始吹這玩意了。

sentences.english: Disco Purge Method can be obtained via your DuPont Sales Representative.
sentences.chinese: 迪斯科吹掃方法可透過您的杜邦公司的銷售代表。

sentences.english: The roaring wind damaged a big tree.
sentences.chinese: 叫嘯着的狂風把一棵大樹都吹折了。

sentences.english: Our holiday plans have gone phut.
sentences.chinese: 我們的假日計畫已經吹了。

definition: failed/busted/to have not succeeded/to have died/to have parted company/to have chilled (of a relationship)
(onom.) sound of the wind or the breathing of sb who is sound asleep
sea breeze/sea wind (i.e. from the sea)
to boast/to shoot one's mouth off
to talk big/to shoot off one's mouth/to chat (dialect)
